body.name: Smart Watch Men Women with Alexa, Bluetooth Call & Text, 1.8" Smartwatch Heart Rate SpO2 Sleep Monitor for Android iOS Phone, 5ATM Waterproof Step Calorie Fitness Tracker Watch, 7-Day Battery
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 6 hrs 45 mins
features: 📞【Bluetooth Call & APP Notifications】Smart watch for men and women allows you to answer and make calls on your wrist with its Built-in speakers and Bluetooth connectivity. Smartwatch also supports information reminders for SMS, Email, and social media notifications such as Facebook, WhatsApp, Twitter, etc. All notifications are reminded by vibration. Never miss an important call or message. (Tips: Please turn on message and call notification in VeryFit APP after Bluetooth connecting.)

💬【Alexa Assistant & Smart Functions】Smart watch built-in Alexa assistant, you can ask for news, weather, and set reminders, control smart devices connected to the Amazon platform, enjoy more conveniently and smarter life. Practical daily functions, including weather forecast, alarm clock, timer, music control, camera control, sedentary reminder, find phone, menstrual period record, and other features.

💚【24 Hours Health Monitoring】Sport watches for men and women equiped with high-performance optical sensors, continuously recording steps, distances, calories, and monitoring your heart rate, blood oxygen, stress level, and sleep status. Smartwatches with detailed data-based presentation to analyze and remind your body status from your wrist, offer you advice for more healthier lifestyle.

🏃【5ATM Waterproof Sports Modes Tracker】Fitness tracker smart watch With 5ATM water resistance, activity trackers meet most sports enthusiasts needs, anti-sweat, anti-rain, so don't worry about when you washing your hands or even swimming or surfing. Supports over 100 sports modes tracking, such as running, rock climbing, cycling, yoga, and so on. Smartwatch provides fitness data, including calories, steps, distance, and workout time, making sure sweating more meaningful.

🔋【7 Days Battery & 100 DIY Dials】Fitness watch compatible with Android iOS smartphone. Quickly 100% charged with the magnetic charging cable, smart watch lasts 7 days based on its large capacity and low power consumption battery. Smart watch for men and women has 100 dials to choose from VeryFit App, and also support DIY dials, so you can select your favorite personal photos as your watch background.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Have had the watch 6 days and the battery is at 33% from first charge! Super easy to set up and connect. Very pleased with the functions and purchase price. A great value!

reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Looks and works great
reviews.reviewText: It does everything you see on Amazon there is a thing you have to pay for if you want all features unlocked but it really isn't expensive so I still bought it, I know some people might not like that but to each their own ofc. The themes are fun some are a bit weird but whatever I got the pink one and its not cheap looking, it's actually quite sleek. Def recommend if you want something cheaper but good quality. :)

reviews.reviewText: My first Smart Watch and it is GREAT.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good Solid Watch With A Couple Footnotes
reviews.reviewText: I have fully tested this watch. In a flood of smart watches on the market this one is good, with a couple of niggles to keep in mind. Compared to other smart watches, the interface is intuitive, easy to learn/use and is relatively bug free. The phone app is also easy to use and learn and has a comprehensive set of exercise and health monitoring tools.What this watch does not have is a blood pressure function. Nor does it have a numeric calculator. It does have Alexa functionality but not Google assistant (I found that most watches have one or the other). Nor does the phone app have a "find watch" function although the watch has a "find phone" function. Another little gripe here is that when you use the "find phone" function, it sets the ring tone and notification volume for the phone to 100% and leaves it there.One function all these watches seem to have is a "do not disturb" (DND) function. This one (and a few others) have an extended DND: Absolute and scheduled. That is, you can set the watch to DND but you can also schedule a time window for the DND. I found the absolute DND worked but the scheduled DND did not fully exit until a minute after the expire time.A final gripe is the phone app is heavily laden with prompts to create an account, subscriptions, awards, badges, hyperlinks and cartoonish graphics. Some may like this immersive type of interface, but I don't.Overall, I liked this watch and would have no problem recommending it. :O)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A nice quality smart watch
reviews.reviewText: This watch is pretty impressive for the price. The first thing I noticed about this watch is that it is high quality, sleek, elegant, and light in design. Setting up this watch was a breeze. I simply downloaded app and followed the instructions and my watch was paired with my smart phone. The heart rate monitor was fairly accurate when compared to the heart rate monitor on my blood pressure cuff. It seems more accurate at rest. The watch also has a pedometer and a blood oxygen monitor, which also seem accurate. The watch feels comfortable on my wrist and can be worn throughout the day without causing irritation. The battery life is pretty impressive with charges lasting around 5 days depending on how the watch is used. The Alexa feature is an added bonus that many watches of this variety do not boast. The display is bright, the graphics are pretty impressive, and the touch screen is responsive. Overall, a really solid watch for the price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Before investing in a high-end smartwatch, I tried this more affordable option to see if it suited my needs. The features like heart rate monitoring, SpO2, sleep tracking, and fitness tracking seemed promising, and the 1.8" display was a decent size.Pairing the watch with my iPhone could have been more consistent. Sometimes it worked seamlessly, but there were instances where it failed to connect, which was frustrating. Another issue I encountered was the watch randomly taking over calls from my phone. This unexpected switching between devices was not only inconvenient but also quite aggravating during important calls. On the plus side, the watch is comfortable to wear, and the ability to switch out the bands is a nice touch for personal customization. The 5ATM waterproof rating and the step and calorie tracker were functional and reliable. while this smartwatch offers some great features at an affordable price, the issues with Bluetooth connectivity and call handling were significant drawbacks. It's a decent starter option for those new to smartwatches, but be prepared for some connectivity quirks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars be 'smart' - try this watch!
reviews.reviewText: i ordered this 'smart watch' because i have been wanting one but i just cannot bring myself to spend the money on the more well-known brand of smart watch (if you know, you know). i'm pleasantly pleased with this one!PROS:- quality. honestly, if you put this watch next to the other brand, i honestly don't think i would be able to tell the difference. some people might, but PERSONALLY, i would not- soft and flexible wrist band in a nice pale shade of pink (i believe other colors are offered, but i selected the pink)- ease of set-up. i simply downloaded the app, followed the brief set-up instructions, and the watch was ready to go- features. this watch has pretty much all the features of more expensive smart watches. i've tried out the heartrate monitor, and it took the heartrate quickly and from what i know, pretty accurately as well (however, i would not use this for strict medical monitoring or anything like that). it keeps track of steps, which is one of my favorite features. it shows calories burned, and can also take your oxygen level as well.even though it has the capabilities, i have not tried to make/receive calls using this, so unfortunately i cannot comment on that aspect of the watch- quick and easy charging- clear large watch face with bright display and vibrant colorsCONS:- when trying to use the 'alexa' capabilities, it consistently says 'lost connection with the app'RECOMMEND?: overall, i would recommend this watch. i like the health monitoring capabilities it has, and the step tracker. i don't need a watch to make and receive calls and texts, so that aspect of the watch isn't that important to me. for what i wanted this watch for, it's been great!
Très. belle montre et d'excellentes qualités. La pile dure plusieurs jours sans devoir la chargée. Parfait pour pour tout les jours elle est parfaite.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Fusion of Style and Innovation
reviews.reviewText: The Smart Watch for Women, featuring Alexa integration, Bluetooth call and text capabilities, a 1.8" smartwatch display, heart rate monitoring, SpO2 tracking, sleep monitoring, 5ATM waterproof rating, step and calorie counters, and a 7-day battery life, has completely transformed my daily routine. This smartwatch not only encapsulates the essence of style but also seamlessly integrates innovative features that cater to the diverse needs of modern women. Here's why this smartwatch has become an indispensable part of my lifestyle.The 1.8-inch smartwatch display is a visual delight, offering a clear and vibrant interface that makes navigating through features effortless. The larger screen size enhances readability, ensuring that notifications, health metrics, and other information are easily accessible at a glance. The touch-sensitive display responds smoothly to gestures, providing a seamless user experience.Alexa integration is a standout feature that adds a layer of intelligence to the smartwatch. The ability to access Alexa directly from the wrist allows for hands-free convenience, whether it's checking the weather, setting reminders, or getting quick answers to queries. The synergy between the smartwatch and Alexa enhances productivity and adds a touch of futuristic flair to daily interactions.The inclusion of Bluetooth call and text capabilities is a game-changer for those who prefer staying connected on the go. Answering calls and reading messages directly from the smartwatch eliminates the need to constantly reach for the phone. The convenience of staying connected seamlessly aligns with the fast-paced lifestyle of the modern woman.Health and fitness tracking features are at the core of this smartwatch's functionality. The heart rate monitor and SpO2 tracker provide real-time insights into cardiovascular health, while the sleep monitoring feature offers a comprehensive analysis of sleep patterns. The step and calorie counters motivate me to stay active, providing a holistic approach to well-being.The 5ATM waterproof rating ensures that the smartwatch can accompany me during various activities, from swimming to intense workouts, without compromising functionality. The water-resistant design adds a layer of durability, making the smartwatch suitable for a range of lifestyle choices.

reviews.reviewTitle: Decent fitness tracker, poor app/privacy concern, typical build quality, inaccurate monitors
reviews.reviewText: This is a reasonably decent (albeit basic in comparison to most others) fitness tracker/smart watch (IDW19) that appears well-built and for the most part works as expected having all 2 of the most common monitors (HR and SpO2, but not BP) which is typical of these devices nowadays. However, this unlike most others with metal casing/shell, the shell/case for this is entirely made of plastic including the buckle which is a bit shocking to see (rarely) and at the same time disappointed.It does have many of the standard features as most other budget or off-brand smart watches have and it has the typical silicone/rubber straps. In addition, it also has a plastic buckle whereas most others have a metal one instead and that tells you a lot about this watch, isn't it? Lastly, it has a single crown which again is rather basic and that's certainly nothing to write home about.≡ NoteThese so-called SMART WATCHES are really just FITNESS TRACKERS with added features (i.e. flashlight, calculator; mostly useless ones too) and it's NOT a true smart watch/device. A true smart device operates by itself on its own without the NEED to install an App for it to run and without depending on another device (i.e. your phone) to run.For instance, if your PHONE requires an App to be installed on a LAPTOP in order for various functions on your phone to work, or if your phone would lose certain features WHEN your laptop goes offline, would you consider your phone to be a SMART phone? Well, I wouldn't and I'll be extremely upset if that's the case, and that's exactly what happens here most of these so-called smart watches.###≡ FeaturesBy standard I don't mean one or two, in fact, the standard nowadays is about a dozen or so including heart rate, blood pressure, and oxygen monitor just to name a few. Unfortunately, it doesn't have the BP monitor but perhaps more disappointingly is the fact that the HR monitor doesn't seem to be accurate at all (SpO2 appears to be reasonably accurate for the most part although we know the figures for the vast majority of healthy people is usually either 98% or 99%) which is quite upsetting to have found out after numerous tests. In addition, the steps counter seems to be off by about 3900+ so that's not exactly accurate either.It also has the typical sports and/or exercise related features that many others have. It has a reasonably large screen of 1.8" but this has been somewhat of a norm at this point in time so that's nothing to write home about either. I should also note that the advertised 100+ sports requires the app; otherwise, only a handful or so are available (which is more than most people would need under normal circumstance).≡ BatteryIts battery capacity is unknown because it's NOT advertised and that's always a warning sign to me because everyone wanna brag about good things and the lack of it usually signifies the opposite. In either case, whatever the capacity might be, the only thing I really care is that it can last me an entire day (charge once a day is fine with me). Btw, I suspect it has a 300 mAh battery based on past experiences.With that being said, I also don't have a clue about the longevity of the battery but that's a common concern for all rechargeable smart watches out there (i.e. battery dies unexpected fast). Note that the default screen timeout is 5sec which is unusably short for me but it can be increased up to 30 seconds (whereas some other can't t at all while a few can do 60 sec) so that's great. I don't necessarily want 30 sec but it's nice to have the options (I set mine to 15sec).≡ Water resistanceBtw, these fitness trackers/smart watches are NOT meant to be submerged in water (salty or otherwise) longer than a few minute even though they advertised as being IP68 or even 5 ATM which is completely nonsensical if you know what that really means (around 50m under water but it's really meant for accidental submersion); otherwise, there is an extremely high probability that it will die prematurely.≡ AppFor those who are curious about what the 'VeryFit' app (3.7 rating) requires;✘ Any data may be shared with other companies or organizations, including but not limited to;* Email address and Phone number, Fitness info, Precise location, Photos and videos, Contacts* SMS or MMS, Files and docs, Installed apps, Device or other IDs✘ Data isn't encrypted (typical practice in China)* Data is encrypted during transit✘ Device & app history* read sensitive log data✘ Contacts* read your contacts✘ Location* approximate location (network-based), precise location (GPS and network-based)✘ Phone* directly call phone numbers, read call log, read phone status and identity, Photos/Media/Files* read the contents of your USB storage, modify or delete the contents of your USB storage✘ Storage* read the contents of your USB storage, modify or delete the contents of your USB storage✘ Camera & Microphone* take pictures and videos, record audio✘ Wi-Fi connection information* view Wi-Fi connections✘ Device ID & call information* read phone status and identity✘ Other* receive data from Internet, view network connections, pair with Bluetooth devices, access Bluetooth settings* control flashlight, full network access, run at startup, control vibration, prevent device from sleeping✘ NoteLike nearly all other budget smart watches (or any other 'smart' devices really) out there, an App is REQUIRED for this to function at its fullest which means you are giving the manufacturer (and whoever they decide to share it with or without your permission) AND the app OWNER (i.e. some company in China and that equates to the gov in this case) your COMPLETE and entire historical data.Some people consider some of these (i.e. precise GPS location, health info, heart rate, blood pressure, or the alike) to be 'extremely' personal information and therefore are private. Data mining, analysis, prediction, and eventually profit making and/or a form of control will be vital in many aspects of our lives in the foreseeable future. If this concerns you at all, look elsewhere.###≡ ValueAll things considered, this is a somewhat decent (albeit basic) FITNESS TRACKER (with some smart watch functions) that works just fine if you don't care about any of the issues mentioned above, in particular the issues with the HR monitor (and the lack of BP monitor of course). Suffice to say I'm not a big fan of the plastic shell/case/buckle and that's quite disappointing to see to say the least. It's a bit pricey at $60 for what it provides (a generic fitness tracker, IDW19) and its overall build quality and performance. There are other options and/or alternatives out there that are identical to this for about $40 or so if you care to shop around. Your mileage might vary.

reviews.reviewTitle: A clumsy watch with a laggy slow screen.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered this through the Amazon vine program in exchange for a honest Review. Here is my review.I own lots of smart watches. Expensive wear OS and Cheap generic versions like this one. I find some of the generic brands very good and on par with the expensive ones. This one however is not. This one is pretty bad.So let me begin with the unboxing. The watch comes with a white strap. You can get various colored options. The strap is extremely basic, Yet it feels nice on the wrist. The watch i got was silver. It comes with a magnetic USB charging cord and instructions.Upon opening the box you are informed to Charge the unit for the first time. Then when it is charged you are greeted with instructions to download a app and scan the QR code on the watch face. The app is called VeryFit. It is a standard run of the mill Generic smart watch app. It asks you to make a account. Offers free gifts and asks for your Amazon details to hook up Alexa. I used my burner Email to set up a account because I really don't trust the app.As i was doing this , I noticed the watch was extremely buggy. It was laggy. Double tapping, Triple tapping. Ignoring swipes. I set it the watch up hoping it was just the initial loading and booting. I even reset the watch. Powered it off and on. Restarted it. To my surprise the watch is just a laggy mess.Upon checking out the app I noticed something that really ticked me off. The free watch faces are extremely limited and downright ugly. All the nice watch faces cost money. Real money. This is not cool. So you are stuck with ugly watch faces unless you want to shell out some cash. The watch is not good enough to justify that type of monetization in the app.The watch is laggy. The steps do not match up with my other Generic smart watches or expensive Samsung or Ticwatch. The Heart rate monitor is off to. Almost everything was not matching up with my other watches. I can understand being a few steps off but 1000 steps is just not acceptable. Top that off with the fact they expect you to pay more money for all the nice watch faces is a hard pass for me.Alexa did not work on the watch for me. It simply would not connect to my Amazon account. Which is a major selling point of the watch.I cannot recommend this watch. Simply put, It is not good.
